title: Next Game
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to any Ballpark Guide page
And there is an upcoming game to be played at that ballpark
custom_expected:
The user will see buttons for:Schedule button, Check In, Photos, and Upgrade (if applicable), 
AND below that the user will see the upcoming game details (date, clubs and time).

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks below the stadium image
And the subnav
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the upcoming/current game section
And the user will see the following items:
- Today/next event section header (it should display the day,date of event in that order unless the game is today)
- The schedule button should appear 
- A cell with the 2 teams that are playing on that ballpark
- The cell will display the away team, then the home team
- the correct team logos will be displayed at either end of the cell
- the time will be displayed , and it will display the time based on the timezone the ballpark is located under

title: Native Schedule View
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide page
And has tapped on the Schedule button below the stadium image
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a Schedule page with tabs for the following views: Home, Full.
(Do this for all 30 stadiums)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads (Check all 30 stadiums)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Native schedule view
And there will be 2 tabs
-Home Events
-Full schedule

title: Native Schedule Scrolling
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide page
And has tapped on the Schedule button below the stadium image
custom_steps: When users navigates away from the today's schedule
custom_expected: A button is displayed that allows the user to jump back to today's date

custom_steps_separated.content: when user scrolls down to see future events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
As the user stops scrolling, an UP arrow is displayed that allows the user to jump back to the current date
AND the arrow will disappear when the user begins scrolling again

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls up to see past events
custom_steps_separated.expected:
As the user stops scrolling, an DOWN arrow is displayed that allows the user to jump back to the current date
AND the arrow will disappear when the user begins scrolling again

title: Next Game - Event Details
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to any Ballpark Guide page
And there is an upcoming game to be played at that ballpark
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Event Detail page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the upcoming/current game cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the event detail page
And the user should see the following:
- a header for the event detail page
- a back button on the left side of the header
- a event information section (which teams are playing, at what date and time, and at which ballpark)
- a checkin button(Greyed out unless check in-prerequisites are met)
- promo for at bat(hard coded deeplink to either playstore or at bat)
- an offer section
- a Photos section

title: Access Video Page
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Ballpark Guide page
custom_expected: Then the Videos page will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When the See All button is tapped in Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be brought to the teams videos page

title: Tapping on the Ballpark (Back) Button on all items
custom_preconds: Given the user tapped on an item within the Ballpark Guide page
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the 'Ballpark Guide' page

(Confirm this for all items within the page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When that specific page opens
And the user taps on the Ballpark (back) button on the top left of the page
Or the user has tapped on the device hardware back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be brought back to the ballpark guide page without fail

title: subnav items located directly below the ballpark image
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the ballpark guide page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks directly below the ballpark image/ballpark name/team name
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the subnav
And it should have a minimum of 3 buttons
- buy tickets
- check in
- photos

IF the ballpark allows for it then
Upgrades subnav item should also appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user examines said subnav items
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an icon associated with each subnav item

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on each item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will go through one of the following flows:
- buy tickets will go to the ticket purchasing webview/flow
- check-in will go through the check-in flow
- upgrade will go through upgrading webview/flow
- photo will go through photo upload flow

title: MLB.com Logo Placeholder for Videos With No Thumbnail
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Videos page
custom_expected:
Then an MLB.com logo will appear as a placeholder for any/all video thumbnails before they fully load
Or for any videos with no thumbnails

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the Videos page opens successfully
And the user scrolls down the list quickly
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the placeholder image should appear before the actual image loads unless the image is missing.

If the image is missing then the placeholder should stay on that image

title: Video Index is Scrollable
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Videos page
custom_expected:
The user will be able to so successfully
And scrolling will be smooth

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scroll up or down on the page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the video items being scrolled

title: Tap on Video to Begin Playback
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Videos page
custom_expected: Then the video will begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content: WHen a user taps anywhere other than the information button on the video cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be directed to the video end level and the clip should start playing

title: Video Controller UI
custom_preconds: Given the user has begun video playback
custom_expected: The the controller UI will appear/disappear depending on the state prior to being tapped

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user single taps on the video item
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the Video player controls

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps again right after the single tap
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the player controls should disappear

title: Video Controller - Play/Pause Button
custom_preconds:
Given a video is currently playing
And the user has tapped on the screen to bring up the controller UI
custom_expected: The the video will stop/start depending on the state video is in prior to the tap

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Play/Pause icon is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will pause

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps the play/pause icon again when the video is in a paused state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video should resume playing

title: Volume
custom_preconds: Given a video is playing
custom_expected:
Then the volume will either be raised or lowered
And there will be a pop up volume scrubber that increases or decreases (depending on what the user is doing)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user increases or decreases the volume
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then The video's volume should adjust accordingly

title: Back/Forward Scrubber
custom_preconds: Given video playback is in progress
custom_expected: Then the video will either be fast-forwarded(left) or rewound(right)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the FF/RW scrubber's position is dragged left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will resume playing at the desired point the user moved the scrubber

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the duration bar ahead or before the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will resume playing at the desired point

title: Back Button within Video
custom_preconds: Given the user is on either the ballpark guide page, videos page, or game highlights page
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the Videos page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the device hardware back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be take back to the page they navigated from

title: Playing Video Over Carrier Connection
custom_preconds:
Given the device has a carrier connection (WiFi Off)
And the user is in the Videos page
custom_expected: Then the video will play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When video playback is started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video should play start to finish with little to no quality drop

title: Playing Video Over Wi-Fi Connection
custom_preconds:
Given the device is utilizing a WiFi connection
And the user is in the Videos page
custom_expected: Then confirm video(s) will play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When video playback is started
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the video should play with little to no drop in quality

title: Title in Video Cell is Correctly Associated with Video
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Videos page
custom_expected: Then the title will be correctly associated with the video played

custom_steps_separated.content: When reviewing the video titles for each video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it should fit the videos title

title: Ensure That Backgrounding/Foregrounding App During Video Playback Performs Correctly
custom_preconds:
Given that video playback has been started
And the app is backgrounded during playback
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to the videos page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the app is foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be directed back to the page they found the video

title: Ensure That Locking/Unlocking Device During Video Playback Performs Correctly
custom_preconds:
Given that video playback has been started
And the device is locked during playback
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to the videos page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the device is unlocked
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be back on the page they navigated from

title: Tap on a song in the player music list
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Music page
custom_steps:
NOTE:
Currently this is expected to fail since all songs are linked to itunes music store only.
custom_expected: Then the user will notice that nothing happens

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a song in the player music list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be brought to the play store to that song item

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the SF ballpark guide
And the user tapped on the music menu item on the team insider
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then The user will be brought to the RDIO webview
And the user should be able to listen to the songs the players/stadium chose

title: Header check
custom_preconds:
Given the user taps on the Map & Directory menu item
And the user is on the Map & Directory page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user checks the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- back button(top left side)
- search bar(center)
- search icon button(left aligned inside the search bar)
- default "search" text within the search bar(left aligned to the search icon button)
- level indicator/selector
And the header will be in the team's color and all elements listed above will appear within the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the search bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the initial search view
And the user will see the following:
- the cursor on the search bar
- the amenities category list
- device keyboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user initiates search
And the user types in a couple of characters
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the characters appear in the search bar
And an "X" button will appear to the far right side of the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the "X" button in the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "X" button will be removed
And the characters that was typed will be removed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has characters typed in the search bar
And the user hits the enter/search button on the keyboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the text he/she typed is still there
And the user should see the "x" button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has searched for something previously
And the user taps on the search bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the "X" button reappear
And the cursor should automatically be at the end of the word/character last typed
And the user should be able to add new word/characters to the previous search

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has selected something from the full directory list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the search bar populate with the name of the selected amenity

title: search
custom_preconds:
Given the user wants to search for a amenity that is offered at a specific ballpark
And the user is on the Map & Directory page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user types "b"
And the user does nothing else(don't hit enter)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a list of concessions with the letter b in its name displayed directly below the header
And the user should also see the keyboard still open
And the user should be able to scroll through the list of items

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the cursor/keyboard is still active
And the user types the letter "e"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the search results should dynamically show results with "be" in the name
And the user should be able to scroll the list of results

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches for multiple words
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the search result should return a list of concessions with those 2 words

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user searches with CAPS on
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the search should ignore the case sensitivity
And it should return a list of results with the word/s the user searched for

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for "beer"
And the user taps on one of the search results
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the search phrase entered should be replaced with the search result that was selected
And the user should see the following:
- the ballpark map(the level the item is on)
- the icon for that concession
- the location information at the bottom of the page(should be listed if there is more than 1)
- the search bar should populate with the title of the tapped amenity

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user already has a string in the search bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not see the initial search view
And the user should see the previous search results

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user searches for something generic like "beer" or "food"
And the user taps on anything specific
And the user changes the level he/she is on
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see search results for that level
And the user should see the icon/location information for all concessions for that search result

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user starts typing characters in to the search bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see search "suggestions" appear as each character is typed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user searches for common keyword
(check the JSON file for common keywords - http://gd.qa.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/cle_map.json)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a list of amenities
And the amenities listed should have the keyword/character on the JSON file

title: initial search view and full directory list
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the map & directory page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the search bar for the very first time
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be displayed the initial search view
And the user will see the full directory item at the top of the list
And the user should the main categories listed directly below the full directory
And the user should be able to scroll and select any item listed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the categories listed in the initial search view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the should be brought to the map view
And the user should be on the level he/she was on previously(default should be the middle level)
And the user should see icons of the selected category scattered all over the ballpark map
And the user should see the info pane display "x location for ****" at the bottom of the view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the level selector
And the user changes the level
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will change the level he/she is on
And the user should see the map populate with icons from the category he/she searched for previously(if the user did not search for anything it should be blank)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search button
And the user clears the search bar (X button)
And the user taps on a different category
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see location/icon of that amenities on the map view for that level
And the user should be able to tap on the icon for more information
And the user should also be able to tap on the info pane to see all available location and the user should be able to select from this list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user clears the search bar
And the user tap on the full directory item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be displayed a full list view of all the amenities offered by that ballpark
And the user will see the list will sort the amenities in alphabetical order as default
And the user will see directly below the header, an option to switch from alphabetical to types
And the user will be able to scroll through the entire list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the list sorted alphabetically
And the user scrolls through the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then user should see the list sectioned off by letter
And the section header should persist until the user scrolls past that section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user switches from the alphabetical to type
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the list should display the items by type
And the items should be sectioned off by type
And the section header should persist until the user scrolls past that section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the full directory list(can be alphabetical or type)
And the user taps on any amenity(it can have multiple locations or just one)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be brought to the map
And the user should be on the level user was on previously if the amenity has multiple locations
And the user should be on the level the amenity is located if the amenity have only one location
And the user should see the search bar populated with the name of the item selected
And the user should see the icon/s for that concession display on the map
And the user should see the info pane at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an amenity with multiple locations
And the user checks the info pane
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the info pane display "# locations for ######"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an amenity with a unique location
And the user checks the info pane
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the info pane display "### level, #### section"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user just navigated to the Map & Directory
And the user taps on the search bar
And the user taps on full directory list
And the user taps on an amenity
And the user taps the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the search clear
And the user should see the full directory list open

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user just navigated to the Map & Directory
And the user taps on the search bar
And the user taps on a category
And the user taps the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be brought back to the initial search view
And the user should see the full category list

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user just navigated to the Map & Directory
And the user taps on the search bar
And the user searched for beer
And the user selects one of the amenities listed below
And the user taps the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the previous item she searched for

title: level/ballpark image check
custom_preconds:
Given the user want to check to see if the maps accurate on the apps
And the user is on the Map & Directory view
custom_steps:
Note:
Tester should most likely have the amenities map open for the ballpark they are testing against.
Tester Should also try to test as many ballparks as possible to make sure the app is functioning correctly.

E.G.
http://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/ballparks/stadium_maps.jsp?c_id=sf

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user compares the ballpark's levels (app vs the web)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see they both match level for level

title: amenities verification
custom_preconds: Given the user wants to check to see the amenities he/she is seeing on ballpark is correct
custom_steps:
MUST READ!
The apps will hit the feed listed below to pull info for all amenities for specific ballparks, so compare against those URLs when going through this test case.
http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/[teamcode]_map.json

E.G.
http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/min_map.json
http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/nym_map.json

Make sure when you run this test you go through as many ballparks as timely possible

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user wants to check the amenities listed in the app is correct
And the user parsed the URL for that ballpark(read the note listed above)
And the user is on the list view of the app
And the user compares whats on the JSON vs whats showing on the front end
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the list of amenities match on both the JSON file and the app

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user compares the location of the amenities on the app vs what is on the JSON file
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see that it matches word for word
(make sure you check multiple locations)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Map & Directory view
And the user is scrolling through the full directory list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see an icon for each item in the list
(make sure the icon makes sense for that item)

title: info pane, location info, and menu/descriptions
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Map & Directory page
And the user wants to check location/information regarding a specific amenity

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Map & Directory page
And the user taps on the search bar
And the user either taps on the full directory, category, or searches for something
And the user taps on any of the amenities listed in the results
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the map populated with Icon/s
And the user will see the info pane displayed at the bottom of the page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user either taps on the full directory, category, or searches for something
And the user taps on an amenity with 1 location
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the info pane display "### level, ### section" for that amenity

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps or slides up on the info pane for amenities with 1 location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the info pane open
And the open pane should have either a menu, description, or nothing depending on what was set in the feed for that amenity
- http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/[teamcode]_map.json

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the search bar
And the user either taps on the full directory, category, or searches for something
And the user taps on an amenity with multiple locations
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the info pane display "# locations for ###" for amenities with multiple locations

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps or slides up on the info pane for amenities with multiple locations
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the info pane open
And the open pane should have a list of location (level,section)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the locations listed in the open pane
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user be redirected to that specific location
And the user should see the info pane display "### level, ### section"
And upon opening the info pane the user should see a menu, description, or nothing depending on what was set in the feed for that amenity
- http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/mobile/ballpark/iphone/config/[teamcode]_map.json

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on an amenity with a long location name
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1616
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see location information fit the info pane properly without overlap, elipses, text crop

title: level button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the map & directory
And the user wants to switch levels

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Map & Directory page
And the user looks directly below the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the level name(aligned left)
And the user will see a dropdown carrot(align right)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the level selector cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a list of all levels dropdown
And the user should see the current level he is on bolded in the list
And the user should be able to tap on any of those cells to switch levels
And the user should be able to tap on the very top cell to close the level list

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a different level
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user's map should reset
And the map should be displayed centered

title: zoom in/out
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Map & Directory page
And the user wants to zoom in on the ballpark map to see where the concession is located

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user pinch the map with 2 finger touch
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will zoom in on the map
And the user will be able to freely navigate around the map

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user does pinch out with 2 finger touch
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will zoom out on the map

title: icons
custom_preconds: Given user is on the M&D

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an amenity with multiple locations from a search result or full directory list

OR

When the user selects a category from the category list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the map view on the level user is currently on
And the user will see a bunch of icons related to the search/category all over the map
And the icons will match the category or type the amenity is related to

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the icons displayed on the map
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the info pane displayed at the bottom of the page
And the user should see "### level, ### section"
And the user should see the name of that amenity on the search bar
And the user should see the other icons persist on the page(subject to change)
And the icons will match the category or type the amenity is related to

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user switches levels
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the icons related to the search/category appear for that level
And the icons will match the category or type the amenity is related to

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user taps on the search bar
And the user clears search
And the user taps on a different category/search result
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the icon change accordingly
And the location for each icon change accordingly
And the icons will match the category or type the amenity is related to

title: bandwidth test with maps
custom_preconds: Given the user is checking the M&D on low bandwidth

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clears all cache from the ballpark app
And the user is on wifi( most optimum case )
And the user navigates to the M&D view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to load the map with no problems

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clears all cache from the ballpark app
And the user is on carrier 4g( 2nd most optimum case )
And the user navigates to the M&D view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to load the map with no problems

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clears all cache from the ballpark app
And the user is on carrier 3g( semi worst case )
And the user navigates to the M&D view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to load the map with no problems

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clears all cache from the ballpark app
And the user is on carrier 3g, but at 56kbps down and up speed( worst case )
And the user navigates to the M&D view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the map will either load(but take forever) or it will timeout and throw "unable to load data" page

title: single game scenario
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ballpark guide
And the user wants to go through each scenario a game can experience
And the user wants to see what it looks like on the next/today's event cell

NOTE:
For these cases the ballpark should have a game scheduled on the current day
Ballparks that have a future game will always display Next Event

Event Module: This is found under the stadium image in the Ballpark Guide Page
Ticket Dashboard: This is the Tickets tab found next to the Ballpark tab

After a game is final there is a 1 hour buffer where 'Today's Event' will change to 'Next Event' in the event module and ticket dashboard. This is the 1 hour buffer referred to in these cases

Everyday at 9am the event status will change from 'Next Event' to 'Today's event' in the event module and ticket dashboard this is the 9am game flip time referred to in these cases

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is still in preview state
AND the user looks at the game details in the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the game time in both event module and ticket dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is scheduled at a ballpark on that current day
AND the game is still in a preview state
AND we have not yet reached the 9am game flip time
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see 'Next Event' displayed above the event module and in the ticket dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we have passed the 9am game flip time
AND there is a game scheduled that day
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see 'Today's Event' displayed above the event module and in the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has entered into a live state(warmup, in progress, delayed, challenge etc.)
AND the user looks at the game details in the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see 'Today's Event' displayed above the event module and ticket dashboard 
AND they both will be displaying 'Live' in place of the time
*test all live scenarios(challenge, delayed, in progress etc.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has entered into a final state
AND we have not passed the 1 hour buffer 
AND the user looks at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see 'Today's Event' displayed above the event module and ticket dashboard 
AND they both will be displaying 'Final' in place of the time
*Test complete games and completed early games

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in 'Final' state 
AND we pass the 1 hour buffer to flip to next event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see 'Next Event' displayed above the event module and also in the Ticket Dashboard
AND the game details will be for the next game scheduled at that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a 'Suspended' state
AND we are within the 1 hour flip buffer time
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN when the Event Module on the ballpark guide page will display 'Suspended'
AND the Tickets Dashboard event cell will also display 'Suspended'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a 'Suspended' state
AND we have passed the 1 hour buffer flip time
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the event module on the ballpark guid page will display 'Next Event' and show the details of the next game
AND the tickets dashboard event cell will display 'Next Event' and will show the details of the next game

title: Double header back to back scenario
custom_preconds:
Back to Back doubleheaders are counted as one ticket so the 1 hour buffer is not enforced between game 1 and game 2

For these cases the ballpark should have a game scheduled on the current day
Ballparks that have a future game will always display Next Event

Event Module: This is found under the stadium image in the Ballpark Guide page
Ticket Dashboard: This is the Tickets tab found next to the Ballpark tab

After a game is final there is a 1 hour buffer where 'Today's Event' will change to 'Next Event' in the event module and ticket dashboard. This is the 1 hour buffer referred to in these cases

Everyday at 9am the event status will change from 'Next Event' to 'Today's event' in the event module and ticket dashboard this is the 9am game flip time referred to in these cases
custom_steps:
This is best to test with live games
If testing in QA you will have to wait for the 1 hour buffer to complete to see status change
If needed you can ask developers to change buffer time to a smaller window.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND we have not reached the 9am next event flip
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Next Event' displayed above the Event Module and in the Ticket Dashboard
AND we will see the game details including the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND we are past the 9am next event flip time
AND we look at the event module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1)' displayed above the event module 
AND the Tickets Dashboard even will say 'Today's Event'
AND we will see the game details including the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back doubleheader scheduled 
AND game 1 is in progress(warmup or in progress)
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1) displayed above the event module 
AND both event module and tickets dashboard event will display 'Live' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back doubleheader scheduled 
AND game 1 is in a final state
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1) displayed above the event module 
AND both event module and tickets dashboard will display 'Final'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back double header scheduled
AND game 2 has started(warmup or in progress)
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will both display 'Live'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a back to back doubleheader scheduled 
AND game 2 is in a final state
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will display 'Final'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When game 2 of a back to back doubleheader has been set to final
AND we have not yet reached the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will still be displaying 'Final'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When game 2 of a back to back doubleheader has been set to final
AND we have reached the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see 'Next Event' above the event module and in the ticket dashboard
AND they will both display the matchup for the next game and the time of that game

title: Double header split scenario
custom_preconds:
For these cases the ballpark should have a game scheduled on the current day
Ballparks that have a future game will always display Next Event

Event Module: This is found under the stadium image in the Ballpark Guide page
Tickets Dashboard: This is the Tickets tab found next to the Ballpark tab

After a game is final there is a 1 hour buffer where 'Today's Event' will change to 'Next Event' in the event module and ticket dashboard. This is the 1 hour buffer referred to in these cases

Everyday at 9am the event status will change from 'Next Event' to 'Today's event' in the event module and ticket dashboard this is the 9am game flip time referred to in these cases
custom_steps:
This is best to test with live games
If testing in QA you will have to wait for the 1 hour buffer to complete to see status change
If needed you can ask developers to change buffer time to a smaller window.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND we have not yet reached the 9am flip time
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Next Event' displayed above the event module and in the ticket dashboard
AND they will both be displaying the matchup and the time of game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND we are passed the 9am flip time
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1)' displayed above the event module
AND both the event module and tickets dashboard will be displaying the matchup and the time of the game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 1 is in progress(warmup or in progress)
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1)' displayed above the event module
AND both the event module and tickets dashboard will be displaying 'Live' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 1 is in a final state
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 1)' displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will be displaying 'Final' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split double header schedule at a ballpark
AND game 1 is in a final state
AND we have not yet reached the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will still see 'Today's Event(Game 1)' displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will be still be displaying 'Final' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split double header schedule at a ballpark
AND game 1 is in a final state
AND we have passed the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2)' displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will display the matchup and the game time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 2 is in progress(warmup or in progress)
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both the tickets dashboard and event module will be displaying 'Live' in place of the time
*test all live states(delayed, mgr challenge, ump challenge, etc.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 2 is in a final state
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both tickets dashboard and event module will be displaying 'Final' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 2 is in a final state
AND we have not yet reached the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will still see 'Today's Event(Game 2) displayed above the event module
AND both tickets dashboard and event module will be displaying 'Final' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a split doubleheader scheduled at a ballpark
AND game 2 is in a final state
AND we have passed the 1 hour game flip buffer
AND we look at the event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN we will see 'Next Event' above the event module and in the ticket dashboard
AND they both will display the matchup and time of the next game scheduled at that ballpark

title: Tapping on Offers & Promotions button
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to any 'Ballpark Guide' page
And has tapped on the "Offers & Promotions" button
custom_expected:
Then then the user will see all available offers
And all available promotions for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the page loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a webview that is similar to schedule webview
And it will list all upcoming promotions for the month that was selected

title: Tapping on the Map & Directory button
custom_preconds: Given the user has tapped on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
custom_expected:
Then the app will open the corresponding team's ballpark map & directory
But will only display if content is available

custom_steps_separated.content: When the map and directory page loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the ballpark directory page
And the user will be able to view all the stores, restrooms, and etc that is available on the ballpark

title: Tapping on the About the Ballpark button
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Ballpark Guide
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to a webview
And this webview will team specific

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on 'About the Ballpark' on the 2x2 grid
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ballpark information page will open up
And the user will be able to tap on all links listed on the page

title: 2_NEW Tapping on the Food Ordering button
custom_preconds: Given the user has tapped on the Food Ordering button
custom_expected: Then the app will open the Food Ordering page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the food ordering webview
And the user will be able to make an order through this webview

title: Mobile Food Ordering (MOO)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to any 'Ballpark Guide' page
And taps on the Mobile Food Ordering menu grid item
AND in (https://qa-ballparkappconfig.mlb.com/android/6.1.0/bpextras.json)
("food_ordering_enabled": true)

* Note WAS and CIN are the only teams with MOO enabled
custom_expected:
Then the Food Ordering web view will open

*To confirm that the correct bundle has been implemented, first verify with the mobile web team & services team which bundle is being used. Then after accessing this specific webview navigate to the bottom of that page and you will see a bundle denomination (ex. "1.1.4")*

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Mobile Food Ordering Grid item
custom_steps_separated.expected: The MOO application will be launched.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Mobile Food Ordering Grid item
AND the MOO application is launched
AND the user taps the device's back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user will be returned the the team's Ballpark guide Page.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Mobile Food Ordering Grid item
AND the MOO application is launched
AND the user taps the back button on the header
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user will be returned the the team's Ballpark guide Page.

title: Menu Item - Check-in Gating
custom_preconds:
Given we have a set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
And that menu item has the "CheckedIn Only" flag checked
And we have performed a Stadium Check-in to the stadium in which the menu item is configured
custom_expected:
Then we should be able to tap on the menu item
And it should launch the Link URL of that menu item

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we navigate to that stadium's Ballpark Guide
And tap on the configured menu item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will have access to the menu item
And the proper trigger will occur

title: Menu Item - Check-in Gating - User hasn't Checked In
custom_preconds:
Given we have a set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
And that menu item has the "CheckedIn Only" flag checked
And the user has NOT performed a Stadium Check-in for the game at that stadium
custom_expected:
Then the user will get a message stating "Check-in required"
And will NOT be taken to the Link URL of that menu item

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the menu item configured
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the item will open a small overlay that informs users to checkin to gain access

title: Menu Item - iOS Only
custom_preconds:
Given we have a set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
And that menu item has been tagged as "iOS only"
custom_expected:
Then the menu item will NOT be displayed on Android devices
And will be displayed on iOS devices

custom_steps_separated.content: When we navigate to that stadium's Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the menu item will not appear on Android devices

title: AR capture mode is available in camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Camera Options
custom_expected: THEN the ‘AR’ option will be available

title: AR experience is triggered by recognizing elements on the TV screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a recognizable element on the TV
custom_expected: THEN the interactive experience is triggered in Augmented Reality

title: AR experience is triggered by recognizing physical objects
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a recognizable physical Object
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical baseball
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical baseball
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical stadium signage
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical stadium signage
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical plaques
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical plaque
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: 3D AR- As a user I want to see an interactive 3D model in the AR space when pointing at the trigger image
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has the AR camera enabled
custom_steps: AND the user is in 3D AR mode
custom_expected:
WHEN the user points the AR camera toward an image 
THEN the interactive 3D model displays

title: Video in AR-  Play a video in the AR space overlaid on the camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user points to play a video
custom_expected: THEN the video players on top of the AR camera in the AR space

title: Link to Webview available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
AND the user is viewing a content in AR
AND that content has a webview button
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps this button
custom_expected:
THEN the webview launches
AND content associated with given content becomes available to the user

title: Video full screen button is available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the video controls
custom_expected: THEN a full screen button will be available

title: User is transitioned to Video full screen is available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
AND the user views the video controls
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the full screen video button
custom_expected: THEN the video will transition to full screen

title: User is transitioned back to normal Video screen in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
AND the user is viewing this video in full screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the shrink video screen video button
custom_expected: THEN the video will transition back to normal size overlapping the AR camera

title: Native ticket purchase flow option available in AR interface
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
custom_steps: WHEN the users is viewing the available buttons
custom_expected: THEN there will be a ‘Native ticket Purchase’ flow button available

title: Tapping native ticket purchase flow transitions user to native ticket purchase flow
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
custom_steps:
WHEN the users is viewing the available buttons
AND the user taps the ‘Native ticket Purchase’ flow button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be transitioned to the native ticket purchase flow

title: Record scanned tags
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has previously unlocked interactive elements by scanning AR tags
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in the AR interface
custom_expected: THEN the user can access the recorded scanned tags which are saved

title: Record Scan in Ballpark Inbox
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has unlocked an offer
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to their ballpark inbox
custom_expected: THEN there will be a message available indicating that an offer has been unlocked

title: Record Scan in Email
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is scanning an item
custom_steps: WHEN the user unlocks an offer during scanning
custom_expected: THEN a message is sent to the users inbox indicating that an offer has been unlocked

title: AR Camera launches when tapping AR/ Augmented Reality from Ballpark page
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on a ballpark team page for a team which supports AR
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the grid elements
custom_expected: THEN ‘AR’ or ‘Augmented Reality’ will be available for the given team

title: ‘x’ button is available while in AR Camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user taps AR for a team
custom_steps: WHEN the user is navigated to the AR camera
custom_expected: THEN the ‘x’ button will be available

title: Tapping ‘x’ closes out the AR camera
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user taps AR for a team
AND the user is navigated to the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the ‘x’ button on the top corner
custom_expected:
THEN the AR camera will close
AND the user will be navigated to the previous screen (point of AR entry)

title: ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction displays before AR is scanned
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the camera
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the instruction on the screen to ‘center image in the frame'

title: ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction does not display after AR scan begins
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_expected: THEN the ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction will not display

title: 4 points display in the camera to guide user to center image within the boundary
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the camera
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the instruction on the screen with a box which has 4 points and acts as the image center boundary

title: Spinner spins while AR scan is occuring
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_expected: THEN the spinner will spin indicating to the user that a scan is occuring

title: AR Video begins after AR image is scanned and recognized
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the AR video will begin on top of the image

title: Web view button associated with AR image/video becomes available when AR video begins
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN a web view link will be available

title: Text associated with AR image/video becomes available when AR video begins
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the description related to the AR video will display

title: Tapping web view button navigates user to the web view  url associated with AR image/video
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
custom_steps:
WHEN the scan is complete
AND the user tap the web view button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be navigated to the correct web view url

title: ‘Rescan’ button becomes available after user scans AR image and video begins or completes
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the scan is completes
custom_expected: THEN the ‘rescan’ button becomes available to the user

title: Tapping ‘Rescan’ begins rescan of target image
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
AND the scan is complete
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps ‘rescan’
custom_expected: THEN the AR camera begins to rescan

title: ‘Dismiss’ button is available after user scans AR image and video begins or completes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the ‘dismiss’ button becomes available for the description area

title: Tapping ‘dismiss’ dismisses metadata associated with the AR image/video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps:
WHEN the scan completes 
AND the user taps the ‘dismiss’ button for the description area
custom_expected: THEN the corresponding metadata will be dismissed
